message: I have a high-quality product available for $100. It's a rare opportunity to get a product worth $200 at a fraction of the price. If you're interested, I can offer you a 10-year warranty and a 30-day money-back guarantee, but the price remains the same. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product without knowing its true quality. I'd like to wait for the next round to make a decision.

I'll give you a 'quality guarantee': if you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you another chance to buy the next product at the same price. You can essentially 'try before you buy' the next product, and if you're not satisfied with the quality, you can get a refund for this one. What do you think?
I'm not convinced by the quality guarantee. I'd still like to wait for the next round to make a decision.
